page.title: 02MARTLESHAM HEATH AIRFIELD.
page.content:
Sited some distance from the village of {Martlesham, the ex-airfield} was established on the open heathland above the valley of the River Finn. Commissioned on the l6th.January,1917, the establishment's purpose was to test and evaluate all new types of aeroplanes, power plants and armament for the Royal Flying Corps. This task was carried out until the cessation of hostilities, then of course, under the jurisdiction of the Royal Air Force which had come into being on 1st.April,1918. The work load decreased as the need for military aircraft became less urgent, but after a period of make do and mend, a new surge of activity came about with the advent of the civil airliner and the light plane.
1917-1939. Gordon Kinsey.
